summary: This document is an email chain between FBI personnel, primarily victim specialists, regarding a newly identified victim of Jeffrey Epstein who is in crisis and located in Indiana. The correspondence coordinates outreach and assistance for the victim.

persons.name: Victim Specialist FBI Denver-Colorado Springs RA
persons.context: An FBI victim specialist based in the Denver-Colorado Springs area who is coordinating assistance for an Epstein victim located in Indiana and cc'ing an agent.

events.title: Initial victim contact
events.description: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein reached out to the FBI, and both the case agent and the email sender spoke to her. The victim is reported to be in extreme crisis and alone.
personsInvolved: Victim Specialist FBI Denver-Colorado Springs RA

events.title: Coordination for victim assistance
events.description: FBI victim specialists coordinate via email to ensure outreach and support is provided to the identified Epstein victim in Indiana.
personsInvolved: Victim Specialist FBI Denver-Colorado Springs RA

keyFacts: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein contacted the FBI on August 26, 2019, and was described as being in 'extreme crisis and alone' in Indiana.
FBI victim specialists from different offices (including Denver-Colorado Springs) coordinated via email on August 28, 2019, to arrange assistance for this victim.
The email chain demonstrates ongoing FBI investigative activity and victim outreach following Epstein's arrest and death in 2019.
The correspondence indicates the victim's identity is known to the FBI but is not disclosed in this document.
An FBI agent from the relevant region was cc'd to make them aware of the situation.
